member.name: T:Google.Api.Ads.AdWords.Examples.CSharp.v201409.HandleRateExceededError
member.summary: This code example shows how to handle RateExceededError in your application. To trigger the rate exceeded error, this code example runs 100 threads in parallel, each thread attempting to validate 100 keywords in a single request. Note that spawning 100 parallel threads is for illustrative purposes only, you shouldn't do this in your application. Tags: AdGroupAdService.mutate

member.summary: This code example creates a ProductPartition tree. Tags: AdGroupCriterionService.mutate

member.summary: A helper class for creating ProductPartition trees.

member.name: F:Google.Api.Ads.AdWords.Examples.CSharp.v201409.AddProductPartitionTree.ProductPartitionHelper.adGroupId
member.summary: The ID of the AdGroup that we wish to attach the partition tree to.

member.name: F:Google.Api.Ads.AdWords.Examples.CSharp.v201409.AddProductPartitionTree.ProductPartitionHelper.nextId
member.summary: The next temporary critertion ID to be used. When creating our tree we need to specify the parent-child relationships between nodes. However, until a criterion has been created on the server we do not have a criterionId with which to refer to it. Instead we can specify temporary IDs that are specific to a single mutate request. Once the criteria have been created they are assigned an ID as normal and the temporary ID will no longer refer to it. A valid temporary ID is any negative integer.

member.name: T:Google.Api.Ads.AdWords.Examples.CSharp.v201502.HandleRateExceededError
member.summary: This code example shows how to handle RateExceededError in your application. To trigger the rate exceeded error, this code example runs 100 threads in parallel, each thread attempting to validate 100 keywords in a single request. Note that spawning 100 parallel threads is for illustrative purposes only, you shouldn't do this in your application. Tags: AdGroupAdService.mutate

member.summary: This code example creates a ProductPartition tree. Tags: AdGroupCriterionService.mutate

member.summary: A helper class for creating ProductPartition trees.

member.name: F:Google.Api.Ads.AdWords.Examples.CSharp.v201502.AddProductPartitionTree.ProductPartitionHelper.adGroupId
member.summary: The ID of the AdGroup that we wish to attach the partition tree to.

member.name: F:Google.Api.Ads.AdWords.Examples.CSharp.v201502.AddProductPartitionTree.ProductPartitionHelper.nextId
member.summary: The next temporary critertion ID to be used. When creating our tree we need to specify the parent-child relationships between nodes. However, until a criterion has been created on the server we do not have a criterionId with which to refer to it. Instead we can specify temporary IDs that are specific to a single mutate request. Once the criteria have been created they are assigned an ID as normal and the temporary ID will no longer refer to it. A valid temporary ID is any negative integer.

member.summary: The set of mutate operations needed to create the current tree.
